name: Hotel Al Sole

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hotel al Sole for the second time in two years. We just love this hotel for so many reasons: the hotel itself is historic and beautiful, the staff is always very nice and helpful, and the location is just perfect -- not too crowded yet within easy walking distance of everything. Plus there are several fabulous restaurants nearby. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to beautiful Venice!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rarely stay in hotels and this was a a gift from our family. This hotel though showed us we should continue not using hotels - it does not bring much value for the money.
reviews.title: Ok but not the best

reviews.text: The location was the best part - 5 minutes walking from Piazzale Roma therefore is easy to get to and from the airport. We were lucky to get a room with view over the canal although our reservation was for a classic room. We did not have to pay extra and this compensates for the other not so good aspects.
reviews.title: Cannot fault this hotel for quality service and location

reviews.text: The building is full of history and is worth paying a visit. However I feel the present decoration does not fit the place that well. It's a mix of new and old all over the place, but it could have been done much better.
reviews.title: great location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception has a strong sewage smell that doesn't go off and makes your stay at the reception not that lovely.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Service, Location, Breakfast Included

reviews.text: I have been several times at Hotel Al Sole, each time on business for a few days. The hotel is well located in terms of reachability form the airport (1 minute walking from Piazzale Roma) and train station. The staff is nice and helpful. The rooms are clean, cosy (although a bit old stylish) and the hotel is quiet. Breakfast is fine. The only thing negative point is you have to pay separately to get internet access ...
reviews.title: Always great to be at Al Sole
Good location in Venice
reviews.text: Good points: Good location, very close to Santa Lucia train station and half an hour walk from Piazza San Marco. Some rooms have a nice view on the surrounding roofs and on the canal. Friendly staff.
Bad points: very old furniture in the rooms, no wi-fi, very poor breakfast and...the room was not cleaned until 5 o'clock in the afternoon!
reviews.title: Great location and lovely exterior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good place, but we could have probably found something better for this price.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well located for the bus station and is in a quiet residential area making it great to sleep. Attractive old palace on the outside but tired and dates internally in need of modernisation. Breakfast was very basic but is included in the price. No restaurant but lots of local choice. Helpful reception staff will book concerts etc.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a perfect location when it come to getting around. Close to the train and bus station yet also close to the sights. The price was also good for Venice although the room was not one of the best as its views were of a wall no more than a meter away which also made the room very dark and as the room had only limited lights it was always dark. The décor in the room was tired and the walls looked like they were in desperate need of attention. Also the dust in one of the bed laps was so thick it looked as if it had never been cleaned but apart from this the hotel was clean and the corridors and reception/common areas was well decorated and maintained.
reviews.title: Good location.

reviews.text: The breakfast was ok and nothing more. Having stayed in two hotels in other areas of Italy before this one it was easy to compare and was by far the worst of the three. Very limited choice although what was there was good.
reviews.title: the best hotel

reviews.text: Wi-fi was very expensive if you wanted it and would recommend going to a bar/cafe if you want to use the net as the price was seriously not worth it.
reviews.title: Oct-Nov 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was good and the receptionists were very helpful and friendly when it came to answering any questions we had.
reviews.title: really good, but no special something

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was good for what we needed it for and i would stay again if the price was right. As for whether i would recommend it to others id have to say i would but get a room with a view and don't be too hopeful of a vast breakfast and you will be fine.
reviews.title: Venetian Highlight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Al Sole at the beginning of May because we were very happy with the hotel in our previous stay in 2002. The hotel is in an excellent location, about a 10 minute walk to the bus or train station. It is far enough away from the crowded St. Mark's area, yet not a long walk or vaporetto ride from that or any other area in Venice. We opted for the canal view room this time after having a garden view room last time. I'm a light sleeper, but I found the canal view room to be a quiet option with a great view. I'm not a big breakfast person, so I found the offerings to be sufficient. Rolls, ham and cheese, and yogurt, along with juice was fine with me. People looking for the big American style buffet breakfast will be disappointed in most European hotels, as that is not how they do breakfast. The hotel staff is helpful with recommendations for dining or sightseeing, and they even offer a water taxi to Murano in the morning for guests. We didn't take advantage of that service, but my understanding is that you must get yourself back on your own. Still, that is still a very generous service to provide for guests. There is a computer in the lobby for guests, but you must purchase a card to use the computer. That was unusual, as any other hotel I've stayed in offered free use of a computer for guests, but it was not a show stopper. In closing, the hotel is very clean and full of character. I have enjoyed both stays and would absolutely consider another stay should we return to Venice.
reviews.title: Hotel Al Sole Was Excellent Again

reviews.text: Ideal setting for short visit to Venice - only minutes away from the Bus Station yet instantly in the heart of atmospheric Venice and within easy walking distance of all the sights. Hotel staff were immensely friendly and helpful (booked us tickets, gave us advice etc.), our room , overlooking the canal, spotlessly clean, and public areas spacious and comfortable. Possible only quibble was breakfast - - coffee out of a machine - but a small price to pay for all the other advantages of this well situated hotel. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Why stay anywhere else in Venice?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights around the same time as the reviewer below Nina2263 and I have to agree with everything she says, except the fruit was replaced and improved greatly. The breakfast is often talked about on tripadvisor, it consists of cereals, fruit juice, various crossants, which were ok, an interesting mix of sugar, marmalade, chocolate, not in the same one, but the French do make the best not the Italians. There is Ham, cheese, hard boiled eggs and desserts!! Breakfast is not the most inspiring but its ok, I have heard from others that it sounds typical for the area. I had much worse in Spain once. There was an occassional smell, its Venice it does. Room sizes do vary a lot, but its an old building and not uniform. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. We had a room overlooking the canal, it can be noisy, with boats, its venetian traffic in the early morning, people are going to work, deliveries are being made. If you want to sleep in stay at the back of the hotel overlooking the garden. The Hotel could do with a bar for evenings, being such a quiet area at night there are restaurants near by, and only 1 small very typical venetian bar next door, but its small and for us it was too cold to sit outside in the evening.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Quiet Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely 4 night stay with my husband in April 2013. Front desk team could not have been more helpful, they were great. Location in San Polo was excellent. Away from the very busy tourist areas, however only a 20 minute walk to Rialto and 30 mins to St Marks. Also only a 5 minute walk from the bus/train station and you can easily walk even with a roller case. Stayed in room 226 which was very spacious and always spotless. This room only has a shower which we didn't mind. This was an inside room with courtyard view so not much light, however we had only paid for a classic room and were very happy with this. We were always out all day so canal views were not important to us. The room was extremely quiet. I noticed some rooms were extremely small so best emailing the hotel and asking for a specific room if possible. Breakfast was continental. Pastries, cereals, meat and cheese, coffee, tea etc. It was simple but a good start to the day. The breakfast area flooded one day when we were there, but this is Venice so to be expected especially at this time of year in some ground floor areas. Would recommend and would happily return.
reviews.title: Would happily return
Glad I had the time to dispel first impressions....
reviews.text: First thing you should know if you intend to book here..... Hotel Al Sole ( like most of Venice) is probably not suitable if you have mobility issues. The elevator is not big enough to accommodate a wheelchair, rigid walking frame etc, and there are further stairs throughout the hotel on various levels.

description: A noble beginning of the Fifteenth century building, located in a very pleasant area of Venice,with delightful indoor garden Hotel Al Sole welcomes you amongst typical Venetian atmospheres and modern comforts.
